ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 8 hours per homework (paper critic)
3 hours.
1 hour.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Only addressed issues in China Invited guest lecturers were also from China Homework trained us critical thinking of basic epidemiological study design problems
Great course. Dr. Zheng is a great professor and I had a deeper understanding of epidemiology, especially some key points which I was not quite clear about before.
Excellent introduction to environmental epidemiology. Strengths: Caring and devoted lecturer, provides a sound introduction to article critiques, wonderful guest speakers. No major weaknesses.
This course did not provide much helpful information than other Epidemiology courses.
Explained basic concepts of epidemiology by a lot of actual studies.
Many of the case studies were the professors ongoing studies in China. Going in, I didn't expect such a heavy emphasis on China.

I was very disappointed with this course, and feel that it was completely unnecessary for people to take if they had already taken Epidemiology II, as the same concepts were discussed in both. I also felt like the course was thrown together at the last minute, and although Dr. Zheng is a fantastic researcher, he focused the entire course on environmental health issues in China, which is not the only area of the world where these problems persist.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Only interested in and addressed issues in China Would like to know a global aspect of environmental issues
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Great professor!
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Outstanding professor, great guest lectures.
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Half of the classes were not taught by himself, so he did not spend much time on the course.
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  informative, humorous, thoughtful for students

Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  He's very passionate about his work. Expects students to have a strong foundation in Epi. It's a little difficult to gauge if he's expecting an answer from you or the question is rhetorical.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Too specific topics in environmental epidemiological studies that only addressed issues in China. Students who are interested in environmental epidemiology are recommended to take the course, but more studies from other countries are expected to improve this course than just focused in China.
Great course to learn how to critique articles from peer reviewed journals using articles about environmental exposures.
I did not learn much from this course, so I would not recommend it.

Our four homeworks, final and midterm were critiquing an article. Although I appreciate the feedback and strengthening my ability to read and dissect research article, this is much too redundant of an assignment. I believe this class has more potential if revamped.
